summary: This is a replacer for the attack (vomit) of Afflicted
descriptionHtml:
This is a replacer mod for the sound of one attack of the Afflicted npcs of the quest names The only Cure.
I made this replacer mod because I dont liked the sound what comes with the attack of vanilla vomit, I meant the vomit doesnt sound like that.
Also I have to say I have made this mod because I really enjoy a mod names, Creepy Zombies by futoshisan, it adds some really zombies to the game, and the zombies uses the effect sound of the Afflicted

I have to say I had to go to The Creation kit to find where the file it was, because just searching something related on the Skyrim folder path doesnt work
In the video you can listen it (the last part "spit" I cut it)


You have two version:

1.0: Sounds like a human throwing up
1.1: Sounds like a zombie throwing up



Installation:

Manually
Just drop the files on your Skyrim folder and replace them If its needed.

Using NMM
Just activate the mod.



I have noticed the sound of the vanilla impact vomit attack doesn't sounds like something liquid, sounds like "shch, shch, shch" (I think doesnt fit), I cant find the file of that sound, If you know where it is, please tell me to make a replacer sound and have the full version of "zombies vomit attack". I have search on creation kit, and it seems the file would be have something in common with chaurus or poison.


[b]In next update:[/b]

Note: I already created a version what replaces just afflicted NPCs vomit sound in a standalone way and let the ice sound FX to sound has it have to be. But, the reason I created this mod was just to work with Creepy Zombies mod, I already created the standalone version, but I noticed Creepy Zombies mod had an update recently... so I need to redone the stand alone version to upload it, this version of the mod modifies the Creepy Zombies.esp file. Also I'm going to create an optional version stand alone just for afflicted NPCs vanilla, not a replacer version, so this way ice sound FX file will be not replaced with vomit sound, to do that I will have to create a .esp file.


Enjoy

----------------------------------------------------------------------------by Maredark3d (Medieval)---------------------------------------------------------------------------
author: Maredark3d
